intro: Piper mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's pepperplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of central Mexico, specifically in the states of Hidalgo and San Luis Potosí. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by small, peppery fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Piper mcvaughii is considered a rare and endangered species.
